ovdesc.p: Tax report file used to store customerwise tax details against a single transaction

desc.p: Transaction reference ID
ID comprises of the underlying transaction's ID, passed by calling application. If calling application does not pass this, check if ID.NEW is available and take that as transaction reference

For an AA deposit arrangement, a credit interest is capitalised and a tax is calculated via an activity AAA1. Then a ST.TAX.REPORT.DETAILS record would be created with ID AAA1. For security, it would be security transaction id and for an account, it would be combination of AC number!Interest.date
Specifies the contract ID of the underlying transaction

In case of AA deposit, it would be the arrangement ID, for credit interest it would be the account number itself and for security transactions it could be the portfolio number. Application to pass this ID
Specifies the company ID of the transaction If not given, this would be default to the current company id

Specifies the contract customer "*" Income.source for this transaction like - credit interest, dividend on bonds, deposit payout, etc
Customer id and income.type together should be unique, passed by application

So, customer 'A', the primary owner, can have multiple incomes generated as part of a transaction like Interest or holdings, capital gains or there can be multiple customers against a transaction having same or different incomes gained from the transaction, like Customers 'A' and 'B' having two different portfolios and having interest income from the same security transaction
Transaction date. If application does not pass the date, assumes this as TODAY

Specifies the securities portfolio ID. For AA deposits, account transactions, this is the ID to which the underlying contract is attached. For security transactions, this is the underlying portfolio id. Should passed by application
